body:
Comment 1: 
It's a bug in make that it has this ridiculous choice of multiple file names for its
rules.  Stu originally wanted only Makefile but people objected to the upper-case letter
and so the compromise was made.  The road to hell is paved with compromise.

Go uses Makefile.  I originally added a check for both, but then the question arises
whether to check for all the possible names (there are others!) or just say, Go uses
Makefile.

Go uses Makefile.

CC'ing rsc, who talked me (easily) into checking only for Makefile.

I could resurrect the check for lower case, but I'd feel unclean about it.
_Status changed to **Thinking**._
